content: The Act titled "Small Business Lending and Economic Inequality Reduction Act of 2015" includes a section on the Community Advantage Program. The Small Business Act is amended to include a new Community Advantage Program for eligible development companies. The Community Advantage Program includes eligible development companies, nonprofit intermediaries, and non-Federally regulated entities. The Community Advantage Program includes eligible development companies, nonprofit intermediaries, and non-Federally regulated entities such as community development financial institutions certified by the Community Development Financial Institutions Fund. The Community Advantage Program includes entities certified as community development financial institutions by the Community Development Financial Institutions Fund or approved nonprofit organizations by the Small Business Administration. The Community Advantage Program, established under the Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994, includes entities certified as community development financial institutions or approved nonprofit organizations by the Small Business Administration. Reservists are defined as members of a reserve component of the Armed Forces. The Community Advantage Program, established under the Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994, includes entities certified as community development financial institutions or approved nonprofit organizations by the Small Business Administration. Reservists are defined as members of a reserve component of the Armed Forces. The term 'service-connected' is defined in title 38, United States Code. The term 'small business concern in an underserved market' refers to a small business located in a low- or moderate-income community, a HUBZone, or a similar area. A small business concern in an underserved market refers to a business located in a low- or moderate-income community, a HUBZone, or a designated empowerment zone or enterprise community. A small business concern in an underserved market is defined as a business located in an empowerment zone or enterprise community, with over 50% of employees residing in a low- or moderate-income community, and in existence for up to 2 years. Small business concerns eligible for the Community Advantage Program must have over 50% of employees residing in a low- or moderate-income community, be in existence for up to 2 years, and be owned and controlled by veterans. Small business concerns eligible for the Community Advantage Program must be owned and controlled by veterans, service-disabled veterans, or have at least 51% ownership by one or more individuals. Small business concerns eligible for the Community Advantage Program must be owned and controlled by veterans, service-disabled veterans, or have at least 51% ownership by members of the Armed Forces participating in the Transition Assistance Program or Reservists. Members of the Armed Forces, Reservists, spouses of veterans, and surviving spouses of veterans are eligible for the Transition Assistance Program. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for spouses of veterans, members of the Armed Forces, Reservists, and surviving spouses of veterans who died on active duty or due to a service-connected disability. The Community Advantage Program guarantees loans for small business concerns in underserved markets, with at least 60 percent of loans made under the program going to these businesses.
